body.p: Kentucky lawyer, businessman, and politician. Graduated from Centre College in 1855. Graduated from the Transylvania University Law Department. Admitted to the bar and practiced in Somerset, Kentucky. Married to Virginia C. Bradley Morrow. Father of eight children, including Margaret Morrow, Edwin F. Morrow, W. Boyd Morrow, Mary C. Morrow, William A. Morrow, Charles Morrow, Sam Morrow, and Thomas Z. Morrow, Jr. Member of the Republican Party and one of the founders of the Kentucky Republican Party. Elected and served as Pulaski County attorney in 1858. Organized the Thirty-second Kentucky Infantry from 1861 to 1862. Served as a lieutenant colonel of the Thirty-second Kentucky Infantry from 1862 to 1863. Elected and served in the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1861 to 1863. Canvassed on behalf of Abraham Lincoln in the 1864 Presidential Election. Served in the Kentucky State Senate from 1865 to 1869.
